meanings.definition: A type of sled used by the Inuit people.
meanings.sent1: The komatik glided smoothly over the snow.
meanings.sent2: The Inuit loaded their supplies onto the komatik.
meanings.sent3: The playful children pretended the komatik was a magical flying carpet.
meanings.sent4: The komatik carried dreams and hopes across the icy landscape.
meanings.sent5: The bright red komatik stood out against the white snow.

meanings.definition: To transport goods or people using a komatik.
meanings.sent1: They decided to komatik their belongings to the next camp.
meanings.sent2: The team komatiked the heavy equipment effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: She joked that they should komatik themselves to school in style.
meanings.sent4: His determination to succeed propelled him to komatik through the challenges.
meanings.sent5: The community came together to komatik supplies to those in need.

meanings.definition: The act of pulling a komatik.
meanings.sent1: The komatik pull was tiring but rewarding.
meanings.sent2: She took pride in her strong and steady komatik pull.
meanings.sent3: The race to the finish line turned into a fierce komatik pull competition.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to his team showed in every powerful komatik pull.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic sound of the komatik pull echoed through the snowy valley.
